Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ok, lets change it to work more like bitmex

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Maybe I just not understood current clue so far with costbasis

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the big issue is that we use the 24hour average

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that means if the mined price is significantly above the smoothed price, a price rise for the next 24hrs is already baked in

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it cant help but go up

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so we cant let bettors use future knowledge. any such future knowledge, leveraged and bankroll is gone

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Attacks vectors on oracle stops us to use realtime price?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the chain will stop if the oracle is someone stopped

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but yes, we cant use the mined price due to the 2% attack

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: miner would just need to bias price 1% higher, place a bet, then bias -1%, to get a 2% swing, which under leverage is enormous

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so we do the prior 24hr 51% correlation using a deterministic random. that means a miner can bias it +/-1% but wont know which block (if any) it will be used in and much less likely if it is a biased price

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so we get the correlated price, but that is literally a random price from the prior day that just happened to be correlated with a majority of prices

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: https://www.bitmex.com/app/index/.BXBT maybe use such index - so to move price 1% you have to move it on all exchanges

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but it is not useful for trading due to this choppiness

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but the miner can submit a +/-1% price

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: doesnt matter the source

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Ah, submit into oracle

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so the average of the prior 24hrs is the trustless price feed

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but this has 24hrs of future knowledge that hasnt been incorporated yet

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the cost basis needs to be based on the max value of the pricefeed for 24hrs

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so that is the thinking behind the costbasis changing during the first 24hrs
